events.message: The customer reported their car was involved in a collision at an intersection, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the vehicle collision.
A claims agent specializing in auto insurance was assigned to handle the investigation of the reported accident.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process would be expedited.
The agent requested the customer to submit a police report, photos of the damage, and insurance details for processing.
Customer provided all requested documents including the police report and detailed photographs of the damaged vehicle.
The investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident began, including assessment of liability and damages.
Investigation completed confirming the customer was not at fault and the extent of the damages was fully documented.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover car repairs and associated costs based on the investigation findings.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely response and clarity during the claim settlement proposal.
The claim was officially approved, and repairs were authorized to commence on the damaged vehicle.
Payment was disbursed directly to the repair shop as per the approved settlement agreement.
The claim was closed successfully after confirmation that all repairs were completed and payment was received.
